alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 10:52AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Osage, northwestern Coffey and Lyon Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1052 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Reading to 6 miles southwest of Emporia. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Burlington, Lebo, Olpe, New Strawn, Hartford, Gridley, Neosho Rapids, Reading, Beto Junction and John Redmond Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 155. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 117 and 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for east central Kansas.
